title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 564.9 - Penalties
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 564.9 - Penalties

State Regulations

Violators of any of the campus parking rules will be
subject to a parking citation returnable as directed, and may be penalized in
accordance with the following schedule: (a) Any violation of the campus parking
regulations: $25.00 each for the first through the third citation received
during the academic year. (b) Any
violations of the campus parking regulations: $30.00 each for the fourth and
fifth citation received during the academic year. (c) Any violations of the campus parking
regulations: $35.00 each for the sixth and any subsequent citations received
during the academic year. In addition, the vehicle will be towed. (d) Handicapped and fire lane parking
violators will be assessed at $100.00 per offense. (e) Fines shall be payable online or at the

University Police Department. (f) Appeals must be filed within ten days at the University Police

Department. (g) Failure to pay
fines or appeal within time period designated shall be considered a proved
complaint and college shall take appropriate action. (h) A late fee in the amount of $25.00 will
be imposed if the fine is not paid within 30 days of the date of the citation. The prosecution and collection of fines involving visitors shall be in
accordance with applicable law. Unpaid fines may be deducted from the salary or
wages of an offending officer or employee of the college. In the case of
students, grades and transcripts shall be withheld until all fines are paid. Individuals with outstanding violations may not register their vehicles until
the fines have been paid. (i) The
towing of a vehicle and/or revocation of a campus motor vehicular registration
and a loss of parking privileges may be imposed for the balance of the academic
year, upon a finding that six or more campus parking violations have been
incurred during an academic year. Violations for which appeals are subsequently
made and granted shall be excluded from the calculation of accumulated
violations. Notes

New

York State Register May 8, 2019/Volume XLI, Issue 19, eff. 5/8/2019

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
